etymology.description: 伤(傷) (shāng, "injury; to hurt") + 心(心) (xīn, "heart") = feeling hurt in one's heart, leading to being sad.
etymology.interpretation: Injuries to the heart metaphorically describe emotional pain or sadness. This reflects the common concept in many cultures of associating emotional states with the heart.

examples.chinese: 我感到伤心(我感到傷心)。
听到噩耗后(聽到惡耗後)，她显得伤心(她顯得傷心)。
examples.pinyin: tīng dào è hào hòu, tā xiǎn dé shāng xīn
examples.english: After hearing the bad news, she appeared sad.

examples.chinese: 他失去了心爱的人(他失去了心愛的人)，以至于非常伤心(以至於非常傷心)。
examples.pinyin: tā shīqù le xīn'ài de rén, yǐ zhìyú fēicháng shāng xīn
examples.english: He lost his beloved, and thus he was extremely sad.
